definition: lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
essential oil of butter
purest cream
to irrigate/to pour/to install (software)/to record (music)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: It is said the love is blind but friendship is clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 据说爱情令人盲目，而友谊却能让人醍醐灌顶。

sentences.english: It is said that love id blind but friendship is clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 爱情令人盲目，而友情却能醍醐灌顶，据说如此。

sentences.english: It is said that love is blind but friendship is clairvoyant.
sentences.chinese: 爱情令人盲目，而友谊能醍醐灌顶。

sentences.english: Certainly, who can really 'strike that cord' in us, will impact our life in a profound way.
sentences.chinese: 当然，对我们醍醐灌顶的人会深刻地影响我们的生活。

definition: murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to achieve supreme enlightenment or nirvana (Buddhism)
practice in which a novice monk is shouted at or hit with a stick with the purpose of bringing about instant awakening (Buddhism)/to rebuke sternly
suddenly and completely (realize, change one's strategy etc)
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
to become enlightened (Buddhism)
suddenly opens up to a wide panorama (idiom); to come to a wide clearing/fig. everything becomes clear at once/to achieve speedy enlightenment
to give instructions/to give advice
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
fully aware/to recognize fully
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
to benefit (from)
gems of wisdom (idiom); priceless advice
lit. spring wind and rain (idiom); fig. the long-term influence of a solid education
mystery within a mystery/the mysteries of the Dao according to Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
